Setting up a custom action (via a button)
Currently, the System has a wide range of custom actions that can be quickly configured if needed.
The
custom action
involves displaying the corresponding button in a specific object profile and/or in the registry.
To configure a custom action (via a button), you need to:
1. Select an action from the corresponding registry (
more about working with the registry
).
2. Use the
button to edit the selected action.
3. Specify the required parameters for the custom action. Learn more about
action parameters
.
4. Click
to save the values entered.
Once the settings are made, the System will display the ability to perform the action (button) in a pre-defined visibility area:
Note, that a user
with no editing permissions, but with reading permissions for the object
, where the button is located,
can click it and view the profile
. This automatic setting is available both for the generated buttons in action and for the
Widgets
button when working with the following modules:
Entering data of a dashboard
Entering adjustments for all forms of methodology
Consolidation by the group of companies
Adjustments to financial reporting
Reporting Consolidator
The ability to view the object using the button (
view-only
if the user has
read-only
permissions) is available for all actions related to the display of reports (the
Open
button, multiple forms viewing, adjustment mode, transformation and consolidation of reports).
It means,
the user is always able to open the reporting forms or dashboards associated with the object, with read-only permissions, using the button configured and view the data
. But the user is not able to make adjustments and save data.
